intro: Cytisus maurus, commonly known as the Mauretanian broom, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces bright yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom in the spring and summer. Its leaves are small, trifoliate, and have a slight aromatic scent. Cytisus maurus is adapted to arid conditions and is often found in coastal and inland regions of its native habitat.
